author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: Happiness is not the reward of virtue but virtue itself.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: No one can have a clear and distinct idea of two things at the same time.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: Those who are believed to be most abject and humble are usually most ambitious and envious.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: The wise man is he who knows the relative value of all things.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: Every individual thing has a striving by which it endeavors to persist in its being.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: I have striven not to laugh at human actions, not to weep at them, nor to hate them, but to understand them.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: True knowledge of good and evil cannot check any emotion by virtue of being true, but only insofar as it is considered as an emotion.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: The highest activity a human being can attain is learning for understanding, because to understand is to be free.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: Man is a social animal.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: Reason connot defeat emotion, an emotion can only be displaced or overcome by a stronger emotion.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: What Paul says about Peter tells us more about Paul than about Peter.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: Nature abhors a vacuum.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: There are two kinds of truths: truths of reasoning and truths of fact.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: This is the best of all possible worlds.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: Nothing happens without a reason.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: The identity of indiscernibles: no two substances are exactly alike.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: Music is the pleasure the human mind experiences from counting without being aware that it is counting.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: Every individual substance is like an entire world and like a mirror of God.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: Reality cannot be found except in One single source, because of the interconnection of all things with one another.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: The soul is the mirror of an indestructible universe.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: Whence it follows that God is absolutely perfect, since perfection is nothing but magnitude of positive reality.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: There is nothing in the mind that was not first in the senses, except the mind itself.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: The monad of which we shall speak here is nothing but a simple substance.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: It is one of my most important and most certain maxims that nature makes no leaps.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: To love is to find pleasure in the happiness of another.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: Men act like brutes in so far as the sequences of their perceptions arise through the principle of memory only.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: Indeed every monad must be different from every other.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: When a truth is necessary, the reason for it can be found by analysis.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: The present is big with the future.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: I do not conceive of any reality at all as without genuine unity.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: There are also two kinds of truths, those of reasoning and those of fact.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: The ultimate reason of things must lie in a necessary substance, in which the detail of changes exists only eminently as in their source; and this we call God.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: Imaginary numbers are a fine and wonderful refuge of the divine spirit.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: The art of discovering the causes of phenomena, or true hypotheses, is like the art of deciphering, in which an ingenious conjecture often shortens the road.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: In whatever manner God created the world, it would always have been regular and in a certain general order.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: It is unworthy of excellent men to lose hours like slaves in the labor of calculation.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: Every substance is a world apart, independent of everything else except God.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: The mind in writing ought to be like a looking glass, showing objects just as they are.
author: John Locke

quote: No man's knowledge here can go beyond his experience.
author: John Locke

quote: Reading furnishes the mind only with materials of knowledge; it is thinking that makes what we read ours.
author: John Locke

quote: What worries you, masters you.
author: John Locke

quote: Government has no other end but the preservation of property.
author: John Locke

quote: The reason why men enter into society is the preservation of their property.
author: John Locke

quote: All mankind, being all equal and independent, no one ought to harm another in his life, health, liberty, or possessions.
author: John Locke

quote: New opinions are always suspected, and usually opposed, without any other reason but because they are not already common.
author: John Locke

quote: It is of great use to the sailor to know the length of his line, though he cannot with it fathom all the depths of the ocean.
author: John Locke

quote: The improvement of understanding is for two ends: first, our own increase of knowledge; secondly, to enable us to deliver that knowledge to others.
author: John Locke

quote: Where there is no law, there is no freedom.
author: John Locke

quote: The end of law is not to abolish or restrain, but to preserve and enlarge freedom.
author: John Locke

quote: I have always thought the actions of men the best interpreters of their thoughts.
author: John Locke

quote: Wherever law ends, tyranny begins.
author: John Locke

quote: The only fence against the world is a thorough knowledge of it.
author: John Locke

quote: Education begins the gentleman, but reading, good company, and reflection must finish him.
author: John Locke

quote: The discipline of desire is the background of character.
author: John Locke

quote: Parents wonder why the streams are bitter, when they themselves have poisoned the fountain.
author: John Locke

quote: We are like chameleons, we take our hue and the color of our moral character, from those who are around us.
author: John Locke

quote: The actions of men are the best guides to their thoughts.
author: John Locke

quote: Things of this world are in so constant a flux that nothing remains long in the same state.
author: John Locke

quote: The great question which, in all ages, has disturbed mankind is: Whether man is born free.
author: John Locke

quote: Liberty of conscience is every man's natural right.
author: John Locke

quote: Fashion for the most part is nothing but the ostentation of riches.
author: John Locke

quote: The Bible is one of the greatest blessings bestowed by God on the children of men.
author: John Locke

quote: The life of man is solitary, poor, nasty, brutish, and short.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: Reason is, and ought only to be the slave of the passions.
author: David Hume

quote: The heart has its reasons which reason knows nothing of.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Knowledge is power.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: To be is to be perceived.
author: George Berkeley
source: A Treatise Concerning the Principles of Human Knowledge

quote: Two things fill the mind with ever new and increasing admiration: the starry heavens above me and the moral law within me.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: Act only according to that maxim whereby you can at the same time will that it should become a universal law.
author: Immanuel Kant
source: Groundwork for the Metaphysics of Morals

quote: Enlightenment is man's emergence from his self-incurred immaturity.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: Dare to know! Have courage to use your own understanding!

quote: Act so that you treat humanity, whether in your own person or in that of another, always as an end and never merely as a means.
author: Immanuel Kant
source: Groundwork for the Metaphysics of Morals

quote: All our knowledge begins with the senses, proceeds then to the understanding, and ends with reason.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: The only thing that is good without qualification is the good will.
author: Immanuel Kant
source: Groundwork for the Metaphysics of Morals

quote: Freedom is the alone unoriginated birthright of man, and belongs to him by force of his humanity.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: Immaturity is the inability to use one's understanding without guidance from another.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: In law a man is guilty when he violates the rights of others. In ethics he is guilty if he only thinks of doing so.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: Happiness is not an ideal of reason but of imagination.
author: Immanuel Kant
source: Groundwork for the Metaphysics of Morals

quote: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: The death of dogma is the birth of morality.
author: Immanuel Kant
source: Religion within the Bounds of Bare Reason

quote: Out of the crooked timber of humanity, no straight thing was ever made.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: All thought must, directly or indirectly, by way of certain characters, relate ultimately to intuitions.

quote: Man is born free, and everywhere he is in chains.

quote: It is not from the benevolence of the butcher, the brewer, or the baker that we expect our dinner, but from their regard to their own interest.

quote: The owl of Minerva flies only at dusk.

quote: What is rational is actual and what is actual is rational.

quote: Nothing great in the world has ever been accomplished without passion.

quote: The history of the world is none other than the progress of the consciousness of freedom.

quote: The real is the rational and the rational is the real.
author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

quote: One must have chaos within oneself to give birth to a dancing star.

quote: Be the change you wish to see in the world.

quote: The butterfly counts not months but moments, and has time enough.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

author: Sun Yat-sen

quote: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
author: Mao Zedong

quote: To study the way is to study the self. To study the self is to forget the self.
author: Kitaro Nishida

quote: In the beginner's mind there are many possibilities, but in the expert's mind there are few.

quote: Philosophy lives in words, but truth and fact well up into our lives in ways that exceed verbal formulation.

quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Ancient Philosophers

quote: Knowing yourself is true wisdom,
author: Lao Tzu

quote: Compassion creates love.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: I think; therefore I am
author: RenÃ© Descartes

quote: The world will know peace when love overpowers the love of power.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Without music, life would be a mistake
author: Various

quote: Never underestimate the power you have to take your life in a new direction
author: Various

quote: . Book by Aristotle. Aristotle Philosophical, Ignorance, Knowledge
author: Various

quote: It is only in the face of death that man's self is born.
author: Augustine

quote: The world is a book and those who do not travel read only one page.
author: Augustine

quote: Faith is to believe what you do not see; the reward of this faith is to see what you believe.
author: Augustine

quote: To one who has faith, no explanation is necessary. To one without faith, no explanation is possible.
author: Thomas Aquinas

quote: Wonder is the desire for knowledge.
author: Thomas Aquinas

quote: The things that we love tell us what we are.
author: Thomas Aquinas

quote: Faith seeking understanding.
author: Anselm

quote: The beginning of wisdom is found in doubting; by doubting we come to the question, and by seeking we may come upon the truth.
author: Peter Abelard

quote: Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day; teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.
author: Maimonides

quote: Ignorance leads to fear, fear leads to hatred, and hatred leads to violence.
author: Averroes

quote: Common sense is not so common.
author: Voltaire

quote: Judge a man by his questions rather than his answers.
author: Voltaire

quote: Doubt is not a pleasant condition, but certainty is absurd.
author: Voltaire

quote: The strongest is never strong enough to be always the master, unless he transforms strength into right, and obedience into duty.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: Only passions, and great passions, can elevate the soul to great things.
author: Denis Diderot

quote: An author is a fool who, not content with boring his contemporaries, insists on boring future generations.
author: Montesquieu

quote: The real price of everything is the toil and trouble of acquiring it.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Generally speaking, the errors in religion are dangerous; those in philosophy only ridiculous.
author: David Hume

quote: All that is necessary for the triumph of evil is that good men do nothing.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: The type of philosophy a man chooses depends on the type of man he is.
author: Johann Fichte

quote: Architecture is frozen music.
author: Friedrich Schelling

quote: We learn from history that we do not learn from history.
author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

quote: To be independent of public opinion is the first formal condition of achieving anything great.
author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

quote: A man can be himself only so long as he is alone.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: The two enemies of human happiness are pain and boredom.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer
source: The World as Will and Representation

quote: It is the greatest happiness of the greatest number that is the measure of right and wrong.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: The worth of a state, in the long run, is the worth of the individuals composing it.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: He who knows only his own side of the case knows little of that.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: It would be contrary to common sense to deny that the distinction between right and wrong is real and fundamental.
author: Henry Sidgwick

quote: The good is the good, and that's the end of the matter.
author: G.E. Moore

author: Gottlob Frege

author: Rudolf Carnap

author: W.V.O. Quine

author: Donald Davidson

quote: Meanings just ain't in the head!
author: Hilary Putnam

quote: A designator rigidly designates a certain object if it designates that object with respect to all possible worlds.
author: Saul Kripke

quote: What is it like to be a bat?
author: Thomas Nagel
source: What Is It Like to Be a Bat?

quote: The really hard problem of consciousness is the problem of experience.
author: David Chalmers

quote: The mind is just the brain viewed from the inside.
author: Daniel Dennett

quote: All consciousness is consciousness of something.
author: Edmund Husserl

quote: The most thought-provoking thing in our thought-provoking time is that we are still not thinking.
author: Martin Heidegger

author: Hans-Georg Gadamer

quote: The ideal speech situation is free from domination.
author: JÃ¼rgen Habermas

quote: There is no right life in the wrong one.
author: Theodor Adorno

quote: The tradition of the oppressed teaches us that the 'state of emergency' in which we live is not the exception but the rule.
author: Walter Benjamin

quote: Simplifying to the extreme, I define postmodern as incredulity toward metanarratives.
author: Jean-FranÃ§ois Lyotard

quote: The territory no longer precedes the map, nor does it survive it.

author: Gilles Deleuze

author: Richard Rorty

author: Xunzi

quote: Universal love is the way of the sage.
author: Mozi

quote: The ruler must be so isolated that he can only reach his subjects through the ministers.
author: Han Feizi

quote: All warfare is based on deception.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: The supreme excellence is to subdue the enemy without fighting.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: Time is not separate from you, and as you are present, time does not go away.
author: DÅgen

quote: What is the sound of one hand clapping?
author: Hakuin

author: Eisai

author: Nagarjuna

quote: Brahman alone is real, the world is appearance.
author: Adi Shankara

author: Ramanuja

quote: The individual souls, the world, and Brahman are eternally distinct.
author: Madhvacharya

quote: Remember often the destroyer of pleasures: death.
author: Al-Ghazali
source: The Revival of the Religious Sciences

quote: The world is divided into men who have wit and no religion and men who have religion and no wit.
author: Ibn Sina

author: Hafez

quote: When the spider webs unite, they can tie up a lion.
author: Akan Proverb

quote: However far the stream flows, it never forgets its source.
author: Yoruba Proverb

author: Lakota Saying

quote: Don't let yesterday use up too much of today.
author: Cherokee Proverb

quote: We are the ones we have been waiting for.
author: Hopi Prophecy
